candidates.name: Nicola McCartney
candidates.why_elect: I am experienced in leading organisational change with senior management teams and with health professionals and organisations in medication calculation competency. From a successful commercial and education background I have specific expertise in strategic leadership. I bring energy, solution-based thinking and good leadership practice for maximizing opportunities for success.
candidates.why_stand: My motivation is to be part of solutions in ensuring we get the best quality healthcare possible for Tairawhiti people at a time when we have increasing challenges with health, equity and funding issues.

candidates.name: Glenis Philip-Barbara
candidates.why_elect: I have a solid research background and a range of skills gathered over a long career in education and the public service. I am committed to working across the entire community to ensure we have a cohesive approach to lifting the wellbeing of our community.
candidates.why_stand: I love our place and have long held concerns about the inequity of the lived experience of the people of our community. I believe the DHB has a core role to play in lifting the wellbeing of every person who calls Tairāwhiti home.

candidates.name: Peeti Wainui Rauna
candidates.why_elect: A matured clinical and culturally appropriate RN; recent PhD Philosophy; Queen's Honours NZ Order of Merit; Gisborne Court Volunteer; and recipient of the prestigious Mārei Apa Kura Award MOH 2013 for Māori Health; engaging, advocating, clinical management with governance to embracing the Tairawhiti District Health Board's successful appointee.
candidates.why_stand: I believe my passionate interest in health and well-being can greatly benefit our region especially the high needs and population of tangata Māori. I can 'walk the talk' in Māori Health Providership of Tamariki Ora, Rangatahi Ora, Maatua Ora and Kaumatua Ora inclusive of GP and Community Outreach Health Services.

candidates.name: Meredith Akuhata-Brown
candidates.why_elect: I have lived in Tairawhiti all my life and understand some of the key issues facing those that also live here. I am passionate about working towards solving inequalities and challenging some of the ongoing status quo thinking that exists.
candidates.why_stand: I have served a term already on the Health Board and have gained some valuable insights into the issues facing the DHB. I believe I have more to offer in this role and want to continue to add value to this governance board.

candidates.name: Tony Robinson
candidates.why_elect: I am Gisborne born and bred. I have 22 years experience as a lawyer/advocate. I have worked with people suffering from addiction my entire professional life. I'm a founding member of Tairawhiti Men Against Violence. I will bring intelligence, dedication, accountability, utmost integrity and an unwavering commitment to equality.
candidates.why_stand: I love our city and region, our amazing people and our stunning environment. Unfortunately the people of Tairawhiti suffer serious health challenges coupled with access and resourcing issues. We need strong, robust, effective and efficient health partnerships to deliver better and more equitable health outcomes for our community.

candidates.name: Clive Bibby
candidates.why_elect: I have lived and worked in a low decile rural community for the last 40 years. I understand the needs and aspirations of the local people. I understand how they may be encouraged to adopt life changing habits that will lessen their need to spend time with specialist care.
candidates.why_stand: I want to make a further contribution to the well being of my community and believe l have the experience necessary to guide the Board in their decision making process.

candidates.name: Tracey Clare
candidates.why_elect: I have honed my governance and financial skills during almost nine years serving on the boards of Gisborne Intermediate and Gisborne Boys High School. I strongly believe in advocating for all people and am an excellent communicator. I bring integrity, honesty and an absolute commitment to our community.
candidates.why_stand: Gisborne is proudly my hometown. Tairawhiti is an incredible region that faces serious health challenges. I believe new ideas and energy is needed if we are to improve people's health and well-being. I am committed to an open and accountable Health Board with greater communication and stronger community consultation.

candidates.name: Andy Cranston
candidates.why_elect: Gisborne is home and I am looking to make it a better place for my children and their children. I have served as a District Councillor and had various governance roles in Sport, nutrition, activity and education. I will engage my experience and work ethic to better our health statistics.
candidates.why_stand: I have been involved in governance in the sport, activity and educational sectors for years. I believe the experience and knowledge gained offers a good fit to the work of the DHB. I am dependable, available, hardworking and thorough and will do the background work to make the best decisions.

candidates.name: Josh Wharehinga
candidates.why_elect: I have a health related degree. I have worked in community and social services. I had a lower socioeconomic upbringing so I literally understand growing up in the bottom of the statistics. I want to bring all of my learned and experienced knowledge to the DHB table again.
candidates.why_stand: I'm so passionate about health in our region. I firmly believe that education and health can improve the lives of many, and Tairawhiti so needs our health stats lifted! We are at the bottom of the statistics and I want to work hard to close those stats.
